text.section: Before a physician treats any patient for any form of breast cancer, the physician shall educate the patient of alternative methods of treatment that may be medically practicable.

A physician satisfies the requirements of subsection (a) of this section if:
The physician provides a breast cancer patient with the standardized written summary described in subsection (b) of this section in language that the patient understands;
The patient receives the standardized written summary within 5 days of the start of the treatment for breast cancer; and
The patient signs a statement provided by the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene acknowledging the receipt of the standardized written summary.

This section does not apply if the attending physician certifies that:
Treatment for breast cancer occurred within 5 days of the physician informing the patient of the diagnosis; and
Treatment within this period of time was necessary to save the life of the patient.
A physician who violates any provision of subsection (a) of this section is subject to the provisions of § 14-404(a)(27) of the Health Occupations Article.
